abstract: University of Pennsylvania analysis finds public school districts in 13 Southern states have overwhelmingly higher expulsion and suspension rates of black children than of white ones.
lead_paragraph: While black students represented just under a quarter of public school students in the 13 Southern states studied, they made up nearly half of all suspensions and expulsions.

headline.main: Analysis Finds Higher Expulsion Rates for Black Students
headline.print_headline: Higher Expulsion Rates for Blacks Are Found

snippet: While black students represented just under a quarter of public school students in the 13 Southern states studied, they made up nearly half of all suspensions and expulsions.
